remarks: Modus ponendo tollens 1, one of the "indemonstrables" in Stoic logic. See rule 1 on [Lopez-Astorga] p. 12 , rule 1 on [Sanford] p. 40, and rule A3 in [Hitchcock] p. 5.  Sanford describes this rule second (after ~ mpto2 ) as a "safer, and these days much more common" version of modus ponendo tollens because it avoids confusion between inclusive-or and exclusive-or.  (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 2-Mar-2018.)
statement:
mpto1.1 $e |- ph $.
mpto1.2 $e |- -. ( ph /\ ps ) $.
mpto1 $p |- -. ps $.
